castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Lakshman Mendis
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Lakshman Mendis
(Balapaduwaduge Manukulasuriya Lakshman Mendis – born May 19, 1955)

Lakshman Mendis is a veteran Sri Lankan actor whose career spans cinema, theatre, and television. Born in Colombo in 1955, he came from a politically active family. His father, Reggie Mendis, was a leading figure in the Lanka Sama Samaja Party (LSSP), deeply involved in the 1953 Hartal and other historic struggles. Reggie’s activism and sacrifices, including his leadership role during clashes with colonial authorities, left a lasting impact on Lakshman’s outlook and sense of discipline.

Educated at Royal College, Colombo, Mendis initially worked at the Embilipitiya Paper Mill, where his involvement in trade union activities led to his dismissal. He later studied gemology and became a successful gem merchant before entering the creative world of cinema and television. His friendship with the late Vijaya Kumaratunga drew him into politics as a coordinating secretary of the Mahajana Party, but it was acting that became his lifelong passion.

Mendis began his acting career in 1985 with Gangulen Egodata, directed by Dr. Dharmasena Pathiraja. His role in Pathiraja’s landmark series Kadulla soon made him a household name. In cinema, his breakout role came with Demodara Palama (1995), where he played “Bryan” — a performance that won him the Best Upcoming Actor award at the Sarasaviya Festival. He went on to star in acclaimed films such as Anjalika, Machan, Peeter One, Sakkarang, Dekala Purudu Kenek, and Nidahase Piya DS, where he portrayed Prime Minister D. S. Senanayake.

On television, he gained iconic status through series that combined art with social critique. His most notable television role was in Koombiyo (2016), a political crime thriller that became Sri Lanka’s highest-rated series on IMDb with a score of 9.9/10. He also delivered award-winning performances in Maddahana, Ahanna Kenek Na, and Sudu Andagena Kalu Awidin.

In recognition of his enduring contribution, Mendis has received multiple accolades, including Best Supporting Actor awards at both the Raigam Tele’es and Sumathi Awards, as well as a Merit Award at the Sarasaviya Festival. In 2019, he was elected Secretary of the Sinhala Cultural Institute (Sudarshi), highlighting his commitment to the preservation of Sri Lanka’s cultural heritage.

Mendis is married to Geetha Shyamali of Balangoda, and they have two children. His son studies gemology at the University of Moratuwa, while his daughter is pursuing psychology at the University of Cambridge, England.

Selected Television Serials

Ahanna Kenek Na as Dunsten Madugalle

Ambu Daruwo

Ehipillamak Yata

Gangulen Egodata as Sirisena

Indrakeelaya

Kadulla

Kampitha Vil

Maddahana as Jayasundara

Mama Nemei Mama

Murugasan and Rain

One Way

Paanamankada

Sadgunaakaaraya

Samanala Wasanthaya

Sudu Andagena Kalu Awidin as Prof. Amarapala

Vinivindimi Andura

Through this extensive body of work, Lakshman Mendis has become one of Sri Lanka’s most respected and versatile actors. His journey reflects resilience, cultural depth, and an unmatched ability to bring complex characters to life across cinema, television, and theatre.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Dilhani Ekanayake
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Dilhani Ekanayake
(born March 4, 1970)

Dilhani Ashokamala Ekanayake is one of the most popular and beloved actresses in Sri Lankan cinema, theatre, and television. Known for her versatility, elegance, and trademark smile, she has won multiple awards for both critical performances and audience popularity, earning her a reputation as the “Sridevi of Sri Lanka.”

Personal Life

Ekanayake studied at St. Clare’s Girls’ School, Colombo. She is married to singer and actor Priyankara Perera, son of the legendary Milton Perera. They have a son, Dilmin Perera. In 2020, Priyankara was diagnosed with kidney failure, a period that brought immense challenges to the family.

Career

Dilhani began her artistic journey on stage, performing ballets such as Ukussa in 1987 with Channa Wijewardena. She made her cinematic debut in Dedunnen Samanaliyak (1991), directed by Yasapalitha Nanayakkara, winning the Sarasaviya Award for Best Upcoming Actress the same year. By 1992, she had already been voted the Most Popular Actress at the Sarasaviya Festival, launching her into stardom.

Early in her career, Dilhani became a household name in commercial films, captivating audiences with her dancing skills and natural charm. However, her career path shifted when she took on a serious role as an abandoned Tamil girl in Me Mage Sandai (2000) by Asoka Handagama. The performance opened doors for critically acclaimed roles in Sudu Kalu Saha Alu, Mage Wam Atha, and Sulanga. She went on to win the Sarasaviya Best Actress Award for Sudu Kalu Saha Alu (2005) and the Presidential Best Actress Award for Sulanga (2007).

Her career spans a wide range of genres, from intense dramas to lighthearted comedies such as Cheriyo Darling and Chaya Maya. She has also been a central presence in television, starring in hit teledramas including Maya Ranga, Swarna Kingkini, Meeduma, Sath Sanda Kirana, Amarapuraya, Dhawala Doowili, Bharyawo, and Deviya Sugala. Beyond acting, she is a regular star of the iconic annual show Ridee Reyak and has appeared as a judge on talent programs like Ranawiru Real Star and Mega Star.

Awards and Recognition

Ekanayake has been honored with numerous awards throughout her career:

Sarasaviya Awards: Best Upcoming Actress (1991), Most Popular Actress (1992), Best Actress (Sudu Kalu Saha Alu, 2005).

Presidential Film Awards: Best Actress (Me Mage Sandai, 2001; Sulanga, 2005), Best Supporting Actress (Ginnen Upan Seethala, 2023).

Signis Awards: Silver Performance (Me Mage Sandai, 2001), Gold Performance (Gamani, 2012).

Derana Film Awards: Best Actress (Gamani, 2012; Dharmayuddhaya, 2018), Most Popular Actress (2015).

Selected Filmography

Over three decades, Dilhani Ekanayake has appeared in a vast range of films, from her debut in Dedunnen Samanaliyak to her recent roles in Soorya, Rosa Adare, Walampoori: Seven and Half Dreams, and Mother Lanka. Her career demonstrates remarkable longevity, with her presence continuing in upcoming releases such as Angara, Tharu Athara, and Magam Soli.

Notable Films:

Dedunnen Samanaliyak (1990) – debut

Demodara Palama (1995)

Me Mage Sandai (2000)

Mage Wam Atha (2002)

Sudu Kalu Saha Alu (2005)

Sulanga (2005)

Nilambare (2006)

Akasa Kusum (2009)

Gamani (2011)

Dharmayuddhaya (2017)

Ginnen Upan Seethala (2019)

Soorya (2025)

Mother Lanka (2025)

Television Serials

In addition to cinema, Dilhani has left a significant mark on Sri Lankan television, where her performances are widely celebrated.

Selected TV Serials:

Maya Ranga

Swarna Kingkini

Meeduma

Sath Sanda Kirana

Amarapuraya

Dhawala Doowili

Bharyawo

Deviya Sugala

Legacy

With her blend of popular appeal and critical acclaim, Dilhani Ekanayake remains one of the most influential figures in Sri Lankan cinema and television. Her ability to seamlessly transition between commercial hits and serious, award-winning roles has ensured her place as a cultural icon. She continues to inspire audiences and younger generations of performers with her dedication to the craft and her enduring presence on screen.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Sujani Menaka
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Sujani Menaka
(born May 17, 1980)

Sujani Menaka is a Sri Lankan actress with a celebrated career in cinema, theatre, and television. Starting as a child star in advertisements, she became a household name through her role in the iconic NSB commercial Sathen Sathe and later through her unforgettable performance as Sara in both the award-winning teledrama and film adaptation.

Personal Life

Born in 1980, Sujani is an alumna of St. Paul’s Girls’ School, Milagiriya. Her father was an art director in films, influencing her early exposure to the entertainment industry. She is married to acclaimed actor Bimal Jayakody, whom she met while filming the teledrama Ramya Suramya in 2000. They married in 2007 and have three children: two daughters and one son.

Sujani is part of one of Sri Lanka’s most prominent acting families through marriage. Bimal’s father is the elder brother of actresses Geetha Kanthi Jayakody and Rathna Lalani Jayakody, while actress Paboda Sandeepani is her cousin-in-law. Rathna Lalani is married to veteran actor Sampath Tennakoon, making Sujani connected to a long line of influential performers.

Career

Sujani’s first appearance on camera came at the age of 3 in Prarthana, a teledrama directed by the legendary Lester James Peries. At age 10, she gained immense popularity for the NSB Sathe Sathe commercial. Her first film appearance was in Ahinsa (1987) directed by Malani Fonseka, playing a child role.

As she matured, Sujani transitioned from child artist to leading actress, taking on memorable performances in films such as Thrishule, Sathya, and Sara. In 2010, she reprised her title role in the film Sara, cementing her position as one of Sri Lanka’s most versatile actresses. She later appeared in the war drama Gamani (2011), the atmospheric Uthuru Sulanga (2021), and recent productions like Weerya (2024), Minnu (2024), Kambili (2024), and Theja (2025). Upcoming projects include Magam Soli and Rapist.

Beyond film, Sujani has been a central figure in Sri Lankan television for decades, starring in dozens of hit teledramas. Her talent for emotional depth and natural performance style made her a household favorite.

Legacy

From her earliest days as a child star to her acclaimed performances in film and television, Sujani Menaka has established herself as one of the most enduring talents in Sri Lankan entertainment. Loved by audiences across generations, she continues to bring depth, authenticity, and star power to every role she plays.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Akalanka Prabashwara
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio: Akalanka Prabashwara is an actor known for his performances in The Beast Inside (2024), Solo Town (2024), and Peacock Lament (2022).

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Kasuni Kavindi Fernando
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
(Born 05 December 1992)

Kasuni Kavindi Fernando is a Sri Lankan actress who gained national prominence for her performances in Sri Lankan drama films and television. She won the Best Actress Award at the National Youth Drama Festival 2014 and received nominations for Best Actress at the State Drama Festival 2015 and the National Youth Drama Festival 2017.

She is known for her roles in Pavi Pavi 3 (2022), Uthuru Sulanga (2023), and Sihina Sameekarana (2023).

producer.name: Derana Plus
producer.bio: Derana Plus is a large media group in Sri Lanka

content.description: The story revolves around two young guys on a mission to get more subscribers for their YouTube channel.

director.name: Chamal Rathnayake
director.bio:
Chamal Ratnayake, who entered the art world as a scriptwriter, first made his mark through the teledrama Jivithaya Lassanai. He later went on to write popular teledramas such as Senehasa Aaradiya and Muthu Kirilli for the small screen, before beginning his journey as an assistant director, paving the way for his dream of becoming a director.

He also worked as a creative director in advertising, and with the experience he gained from that, he served as an assistant director in several well-known teledramas including Muthu Kirilli, Amanda, Piyagata Pela, Swayamjatha, Girikula, Man Asai Piyambanna, Pavuru Palama, and Sihini Cinderella—productions that are still remembered by thousands of fans today.

After gaining extensive experience as an assistant director, he went on to direct about 400 episodes of the Janai Priyai YouTube channel, establishing himself as a successful director.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Dheera Serasinghe
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Dheera Serasinghe

Dheera Serasinghe is a renowned performer known for his versatile performances and captivating screen presence. He has established himself as a prominent figure in the entertainment industry. On Twitter, he shares updates about his upcoming projects. On Instagram under the handle @dheera_serasinghe, he shares personal moments, on-set photos, and interacts with followers. Dheera Serasinghe’s official website showcases his work through a photo gallery, video clips, and a detailed biography.

castMemberCommonResDTO.name: Sudarshi Gelanigama
castMemberCommonResDTO.bio:
Sudarshi Gelanigama is a Sri Lankan actress known for her performances across a variety of popular television dramas. Her recent work reflects a strong presence in both mainstream and genre-based storytelling.
